result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S. Bergman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew S. Bergman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Def requesting for reduction of monthly payment plan

Case called @ 3:40 p.m. Defendant Matthew S. Bergman in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court withdraws the warrant previously issued.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not wish to have counsel and wishes to enter a plea.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. Sentencing recommendation by ADA Anderson. No statement by DE. Court orders: 60 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 yr probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Voluntary appearance on February 18, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
from the DE requesting a Voluntary Appearance - Granted by the court, warrant to remain in place until the VA

Case Called @ 2:18 PM: Defendant Matthew S. Bergman not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Arrest warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition in light of nonappearance.
